## Preamble

For an Rmd file to be successfully exported to HTML and PDF, read [this page](http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/).

Practically, open R and type:
```{r, eval=FALSE}
library(rmarkdown)
render("myanalysis.Rmd", "all")
```

Any Rmd file is best edited with RStudio, or Emacs with ESS, markdown and polymode.


Example of an equation written in LaTeX: $y_i \sim \mathcal{N}(\mu, \sigma^2)$

Example of a list:

* $\mu$

* $\sigma$

Example of a plot from R:
```{r plot_hist}
hist(rnorm(10^4), breaks="FD")
```

Example of a table from R:
```{r, results='asis'}
knitr::kable(mtcars[1:5,])
```
